definition: lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
to wipe
to plaster/to go around/to skirt
to smear/to wipe/to erase/classifier for wisps of cloud, light-beams etc
surname Jue
role (theater)/to compete/ancient three legged wine vessel/third note of pentatonic scale
angle/corner/horn/horn-shaped/unit of money equal to 0.1 yuan, or 10 cents (a dime)/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Americans talk like their poems, as soon as possible into the topic, won't beat around the bush.
sentences.chinese: 美国人说话喜欢直抒胸臆，尽快入题，不会拐弯抹角。

sentences.english: Don't beat the bushes ,tell me what the earth happened.
sentences.chinese: 别拐弯抹角地解释了，告诉我究竟发生了什么。

sentences.english: Or it burrowed through the problem by some circuitous loophole of logic.
sentences.chinese: 或者通过某种拐弯抹角的逻辑漏洞草草掠过问题。

sentences.english: He knows what his job requires and he calls it the way he sees it.
sentences.chinese: 他知道自己的工作有哪些要求，而且他从不拐弯抹角。

sentences.english: Cecily: When I see a spade, I call it a spade .
sentences.chinese: 我看到铲子，就叫它铲子，不拐弯抹角。

sentences.english: He always asks me favors in a roundabout way.
sentences.chinese: 他总是拐弯抹角地求我办事。

sentences.english: This answers the questions about the future of the universe in a indirect way.
sentences.chinese: 这样就拐弯抹角的回答了前面关于宇宙未来的疑问。
人们在拐弯抹角地讨论这件事。

sentences.english: "It's a pre-decisional situation, " he says obliquely.
sentences.chinese: “现在是决策之前的环境，”他拐弯抹角的说。

sentences.english: Cooperating the principle can not explain people why want to talk in a round-about way .
sentences.chinese: 合作原则未能解释人们为何要拐弯抹角地说话。

definition: lit. to go on a long detour/fig. to speak vaguely around the topic without getting to the point/to beat about the bush
see 拐彎抹角|拐弯抹角[guai3 wan1 mo4 jiao3]
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
lit. to open the door and see the mountain; fig. to get right to the point (idiom)
direct and plainspoken (idiom); blunt/straightforward
going directly (without detour)/(fig.) direct/straightforward (in one's manner or speech)
to encircle/to go around/to circle/to beat about the bush
to go for a walk around/fig. to speak in a roundabout way
to get straight to the point (idiom)
to illuminate/to open up (a topic)
blunt/outspoken
bend/turn/curve
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
not to mince words/not to beat about the bush
pinyin: da3 kai1 tian1 chuang1 shuo1 liang4 hua4

definition: polite greeting/civilities/to exchange pleasantries
